results.title: Adventure Island: The Diamond Tree
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), John Michael Howson and Godfrey Philipp
results.brief_description:
Ho ho, ho ho, its far away we go, to a land that’s far across the sea. Hey hey, hey hey, for a little while we’ll stay, and be home in time for tea……..

The popular long-running children’s program ‘Adventure Island’ is set in the kingdom of Diddley-Dum-Diddley, and follows the continuing adventures of Liza, Clown, Mrs Flower Potts, Percy and Dodo Panda and their friends.

In this episode, a magical plant produces diamond flowers.

results.title: 7.30 Report: The Dismissal
results.brief_description:
On the eve of the thirtieth anniversary of the dismissal of the Whitlam government, a special edition of the ABC’s national nightly current affairs program, ‘7:30 Report’ takes an in-depth look at the events of 1975.

The program features interviews with both Gough Whitlam and Malcolm Fraser who comment on the events of 1975, discuss the possibility of 4 year fixed terms for both the House of Representatives and the Senate and reflect upon the politics of modern Australia, and upon each other.

Broadcast on 10th November, 2005.

results.title: Qantas: I Still Call Australia Home [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Over twenty years, Qantas has produced a series of commercials featuring the Peter Allen song ‘I Still Call Australia Home’. This is the original mid 1980s version.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Channel Seven Sport : Up There Cazaly [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A television commercial for Channel Seven Sport’s coverage of Australian Rules Football, using the song ‘Up There Cazaly’ written by Mike Brady and Peter Sullivan. The song was inspired by the high flying marks of Roy Cazaly who played during the 1920s. The commercial shows some spectacular high marks and bruising bumps.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Holeproof Computer Socks [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A commercial for Holeproof ‘Computer Socks’ set in a patent office, where the inventor’s glee at his discovery (‘they fall up, not down’) causes Isaac Newton to rethink his theory of gravity.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Lamb Roast [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Naomi Watts stars in this commercial as the girl that wins a date with Tom Cruise but turns it down so she can be at home for one of her Mum’s lamb roasts.
Produced by Campaign Palace.
